sen.j: また、たとえ事実であったとしてもそれは家格の高さを示す事こそあれ、軟弱さの象徴とは言い難い。
sen.e: Even if it is true, it indicates nothing more than his high social standing, and it can not be seen as a symbol of his weakness.
Even if it is true, it indicates nothing more than his high social standing and cannot be seen as a symbol of his weakness.
sen.cmt: eliminated comma after "standing"; eliminated "it" after "and"; can not > cannot;
sen.e: Even if it is true, it indicates nothing more than his high social standing and cannot be seen as a symbol of his weakness.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 武士が戦場に向かう際に化粧をしていくことは、珍しくないばかりかたしなみの一つであったと言う説すらある（笹間良彦『時代考証 日本合戦図図典』）。
sen.e: Even there exist a theory that warring makeup was not a queer habit but an established code that a samurai should follow when he was going to battlefield (Yoshihiko SASAMA "Jidaikosho Nihon Kassen-zu Zuten" (Historical scrutiny: Illustrated dictionary of Japanese battle).
sen.cmt: 『時代考証 日本合戦図図典』→定訳不明："Jidaikosho Nihon Kassen-zu Zuten" (Historical scrutiny: Illustrated dictionary of Japanese battle) としました。
sen.e: In yet another theory, it is argued that wearing makeup was not a queer habit but an established code that samurai should follow when going in to the battlefield (Yoshihiko SASAMA "Jidaikosho Nihon Kassen-zu Zuten" (Historical scrutiny: Illustrated dictionary of Japanese battle).
sen.cmt: Even there exist a theory > In yet another theory, it is argued"; fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: In yet another theory, it is argued that wearing makeup was not a queer habit but an established code that samurai should follow when going in to the battlefield (Yoshihiko SASAMA "Jidaikosho Nihon Kassen-zu Zuten" (Historical scrutiny: Illustrated dictionary of Japanese battle).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 『信長公記』では義元の桶狭間の戦いの際の出で立ちを「胸白の鎧に金にて八龍を打ちたる五枚兜を被り、赤地の錦の陣羽織を着し、今川家重代の二尺八寸松倉郷の太刀に、壱尺八寸の大左文字の脇差を帯し、青の馬の五寸計（馬高五尺五寸の青毛の馬）なるの金覆輪の鞍置き、紅の鞦かけて乗られける……。」と伝えている。
sen.e: In Shincho Koki (Biography of the Warlord Nobunaga ODA), Yoshitomo's costume to go to the Battle of Okehazama is described as follows: 'Yoshimoto, who was dressed in armor with a white cuirass and a five-pieces combat helmet decorated with a gold embossed pattern of a legendary dragon Hachiryu, and a red brocaded Jinbaori (sleeveless campaign jacket worn over armor), took a long sword of some 85cm with the inscription of Matsukurago (sword made by GO no Yoshihiro), the family treasure handed down for generations in the Imagawa family, and a short sword of some 55cm with the inscription of Dai-samonji (sword made by Samonji SOZA), and sat straddled upon a jet-black horse of some 166.65cm high with a gold-rimmed saddle, which was fixed by a scarlet breeching...'
sen.cmt: 下列にあった 『」と伝えている。』 を本列に加えました。尺→about 30.3cm で計算しました。寸→about 3.03cmで計算しました。二尺八寸→some 85cm (2.8×30.3cmで計算しました。) 松倉郷 →定訳不明：with the inscription of Matsukurago (sword made by GO no Yoshihiro) としました。壱尺八寸→ some 55cm (1.8×30.3cmで計算しました。)大左文字→定訳不明：with the inscription of Dai-samonji (sword made by Samonji SOZA) としました。青の馬の五寸計（馬高五尺五寸の青毛の馬）→ 定訳不明：jet-black horse of some 166.65cm high (5.5×30.3cmで計算しました。) としました。金覆輪の鞍→定訳不明：gold-rimmed saddle としました。鞦→定訳不明：breeching としました。
sen.e: In the Shincho Koki (Biography of the Warlord Nobunaga ODA), Yoshitomo's costume during the Battle of Okehazama is described as follows: 'Yoshimoto was dressed in armor with a white cuirass and a five-piece combat helmet decorated with a gold embossed pattern of the legendary dragon Hachiryu; he wore a red brocaded Jinbaori (sleeveless campaign jacket worn over armor), wielded a long sword approximately 85cm long with the inscription of Matsukurago (a sword made by GO no Yoshihiro), a family treasure handed down for generations in the Imagawa family, and a short sword with approximately 55cm in length with the inscription of Dai-samonji (a sword made by Samonji SOZA); he sat straddled upon a jet-black horse of about 166.65cm tall with a gold-rimmed saddle, fixed by a scarlet breeching...'
sen.cmt: added "the" before "Shincho"; costume to go to > costume during; fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: In the "Shincho Koki" (Biography of the Warlord Nobunaga ODA), Yoshimoto's costume during the Battle of Okehazama is described as follows: 'Yoshimoto was dressed in armor with a white cuirass and a five-piece combat helmet decorated with a gold embossed pattern of the legendary dragon Hachiryu; he wore a red brocaded Jinbaori (sleeveless campaign jacket worn over armor), wielded a long sword approximately 85cm long with the inscription of Matsukurago (a sword made by GO no Yoshihiro), a family treasure handed down for generations in the Imagawa family, and a short sword with approximately 55cm in length with the inscription of Dai-samonji (a sword made by Samonji SOZA); he sat straddled upon a jet-black horse of about 166.65cm tall with a gold-rimmed saddle, fixed by a scarlet breeching...'
sen.cmt: 原文の下段にあった”」と伝えている。”を組み入れ、元のセルを削除しました。（訳の段階ではコメント欄にその旨が残されていましたが未処理であったため）クォーツを補いました。Yoshitomo→Yoshimoto と修正しました。

sen.j: 通説では松平広忠にとって唯一の嫡男である竹千代（徳川家康）を人質に取ったことは、今川家による松平家に対する過酷な処遇と解釈されてきた。
sen.e: In the popular theory, his act of taking Hirotada MATSUDAIRA's only legitimate son Takechiyo (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA) as a hostage has been considered as a the Imagawa family's cruel treatment to Matsudaira family.
According to popular theory, Yoshimoto's act of taking Hirotada MATSUDAIRA's only legitimate son Takechiyo (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA) as a hostage is considered as cruel treatment to the Matsudaira family.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: According to popular theory, Yoshimoto's act of taking Hirotada MATSUDAIRA's only legitimate son Takechiyo (Ieyasu TOKUGAWA) as a hostage has been considered as cruel treatment to the Matsudaira family.
sen.cmt: is→has been と修正しました。（「・・・されてきた」ということから）

sen.j: しかし、近年の研究では、今川義元側の見地として、西三河最大の今川の与党である岡崎松平家を重視しての（好意的な）政策だったという説も唱えられるようになってきた。
sen.e: However, as a result of the recent studies, some theories present a point of view from the Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's side and argue that it had been a (favorable) policy of the Imagawa family which was attaching great importance to the Okazaki Matsudaira family because it was the largest family on the Imagawa side in Nishimikawa (western part of Mikawa Province).
sen.cmt: 今川の与党→on the Imagawa side としました。
sen.e: As a result of recent studies, however, a number of theories arguing from Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's side claim that it was a (favorable) policy of the Imagawa family to attach great importance to the Okazaki Matsudaira family since it was the largest family on the Imagawa side in Nishimikawa (the western part of Mikawa Province).
sen.cmt: fixed grammar tor read more naturally;
sen.e: As a result of recent studies, however, a number of theories arguing from Yoshimoto IMAGAWA's side claim that it was a (favorable) policy of the Imagawa family to attach great importance to the Okazaki Matsudaira family since it was the largest family on the Imagawa side in Nishimikawa (the western part of Mikawa Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 例えば、幼少期の家康を駿河国に留め置いたのは今川家の準一門扱いとして厚遇であり、人質というよりも「政務見習い」として預けられたという物である。
sen.e: For example, there is a theory that the Imagawa family placed little Ieyasu under its custody in Suruga Province and treated him as a member of junichimon (associate family), and Ieyasu was left to Yoshimoto's care as 'an apprentice of the government affaires,' rather than as a hostage.

For example, there is a theory that the Imagawa family placed little Ieyasu under their custody in Suruga Province, treating him as a member of their junichimon (associate family), and Ieyasu was left to Yoshimoto's care as 'an apprentice of the government affaires,' rather than as a hostage.
sen.cmt: its custody > their custody; treated > treating; added "their" before "junichimon";
sen.e: For example, there is a theory that the Imagawa family placed little Ieyasu under their custody in Suruga Province, treating him as a member of their junichimon (associate family), and Ieyasu was left to Yoshimoto's care as 'an apprentice of the government affairs,' rather than as a hostage.
sen.cmt: affaires→affairs と修正しました。

sen.j: 実際に太原雪斎 の英才教育を受けさせたとの説もある（これに反する異論もある）。
sen.e: In reality, there is also a theory that Yoshimoto gave him a special education for talented students conducted by Sessai TAIGEN (there are objections to this theory).
There is also another theory that Yoshimoto gave Takechiyo a special education for talented students conducted by Sessai TAIGEN (there are objections to this theory as well).
sen.cmt: In reality > another; added "as well" after "theory"; fixed grammar
sen.e: There is also another theory that Yoshimoto gave Takechiyo a special education for talented students conducted by Sessai TAIGEN (there are objections to this theory as well).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 姪である築山殿を嫁がせたことも、家康を今川家に縛り付けたという解釈もできるが、順当に考えれば今川家と縁戚関係を結ぶ事であり厚遇と言える。
sen.e: The marriage that Yoshimoto forced his niece Tsukiyama-dono to contract with Ieyasu can be interpreted as a measure to tie Ieyasu to the Imagawa family, but it can be also straightforwardly understood as a special favor that Ieyasu was given to become a relative of the Imagawa family.

The marriage Yoshimoto forced on his niece Tsukiyama with Ieyasu can be interpreted as a measure to tie Ieyasu to the Imagawa family, but it can be also understood as an honest special favor to turn Ieyasu into a relative of the Imagawa family.
sen.cmt: straightforwardly > honest; fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: The marriage Yoshimoto forced on his niece Tsukiyama with Ieyasu can be interpreted as a measure to tie Ieyasu to the Imagawa family, but it can be also understood as an honest special favor to turn Ieyasu into a relative of the Imagawa family.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかし、松平氏の家臣にとっては嫡男（特に広忠の死後は主君）を人質に取られていると言う事実に変わりは無く、立場上弱い面からの圧力などがあったようである（墓参りのために岡崎城に一時帰参した家康に対し、鳥居忠吉が今川の横暴を訴えている）。
sen.e: However, it is true for the vassals of the Matsudaira clan that the eldest legitimate son of their lord (and particularly, after Hirotada's death, their lord) was taken as a hostage, and it seems that they felt a certain pressure because of their disadvantaged position (to Ieyasu, who temporarily retuned to the Okazaki-ji Castle to pay his ancestors a visit, Tadayoshi TORII complained about the Imagawa family's autocratic manner).

To the vassals of the Matsudaira clan, however, it was a fact that the eldest legitimate son of their lord (and particularly, after Hirotada's death, their lord) was taken as hostage, and it seems that they felt a certain amount of pressure due to their disadvantaged position (Tadayoshi TORII complained to Ieyasu, who temporarily returned to the Okazaki-ji Castle to pay his ancestors a visit, about the Imagawa family's autocratic manner).
sen.cmt: retuned > returned; fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: To the vassals of the Matsudaira clan, however, it was a fact that the legitimate son of their lord (and particularly, after Hirotada's death, their lord) was taken as hostage, and it seems that they felt a certain amount of pressure due to their disadvantaged position (Tadayoshi TORII complained to Ieyasu, who temporarily returned to the Okazaki-ji Castle to pay his ancestors a visit, about the Imagawa family's autocratic manner.)
sen.cmt: eldest を削除しました。（嫡男としかないため）ピリオドの位置を修正しました。

sen.j: また、竹千代が義元の家臣（孕石元泰）から個人的な虐めを受けるなど、忍従の日々であったことに違いは無く、後世、徳川家側の主観のみが広がり、従来の通説になったと考えられる。
sen.e: And there is no doubt that Takechiyo (later Ieyasu) was living a life full of sufferance such as Yoshimoto's vassal (Tomoyasu HARAMIISHI)'s personal humiliation, and therefore, it is natural to consider that the only Tokugawa family's subjective vision had extended to become the traditional common view.
sen.cmt: 竹千代→Takechiyo (later Ieyasu) としました。
sen.e: There is no doubt that Takechiyo's life was full of sufferances, such as the personal humiliation he received from one of Yoshimoto's vassals (Tomoyasu HARAMIISHI), so it is only natural for the subjective standpoint of the Tokugawa family to be extended to the traditional common view.
sen.cmt: eliminated "And,"; eliminated (later Ieyasu); fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: There is no doubt that Takechiyo's life was full of sufferances, such as the personal humiliation he received from one of Yoshimoto's vassals (Tomoyasu HARAMIISHI), so it is only natural for the subjective standpoint of the Tokugawa family to be extended to the traditional common view.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: もっとも家康は隠居先に忍従の日々だったはずの駿河を選んでいることも事実である。
sen.e: For certain, Ieyasu chose Suruga for his place of retirement, although he must have lived the days of patience during his childhood there.
One thing for certain, is that Ieyasu chose Suruga as his place for retirement even though he had supposedly been living a submissive life during his days living there as a child.
sen.cmt: although > even though; fixed grammar to read more naturally;
sen.e: One thing for certain, is that Ieyasu chose Suruga as his place for retirement even though he had supposedly been living a submissive life during his days living there as a child.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 永禄3年（1560年）の尾張侵攻は、上洛目的説と織田信長討伐・尾張攻略説とがある。
sen.e: There are two theories on the invasion of Owari Province in 1560, one is the theory that Yoshimoto's objective was proceeding to the capital (Kyoto), and the other is that he was aiming at putting down Nobunaga ODA and capturing Owari Province.
sen.cmt: 上洛目的説→定訳不明：the theory that Yoshimoto's objective was proceeding to the capital (Kyoto) としました。織田信長討伐・尾張攻略説→定訳不明：(the theory) that he was among at putting down Nobunaga ODA and capturing Owari Province としました。
sen.e: There are two theories on why Yoshimoto made an invasion into the Owari Province in 1560; one is that Yoshimoto had the objective of proceeding to the capital (Kyoto), and the other is that he was aiming at putting down Nobunaga ODA and capturing Owari Province.
sen.cmt: Rewording
sen.e: There are two theories on why Yoshimoto made an invasion into the Owari Province in 1560; one is that Yoshimoto had the objective of proceeding to the capital (Kyoto), and the other is that he was aiming at putting down Nobunaga ODA and capturing Owari Province.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
